New Records: Fotis Ioannidis scored a brace for Greece, including a goal in the 24th minute and another in the 77th minute, contributing to a 3-0 win over Finland in the UEFA Nations League on September 7th, 2024.
Key Match Events: Fotis Ioannidis scored two goals for Greece, while Jukka Raitala scored an own goal for Finland in the 38th minute.
Bjorn Kallman received a yellow card for Finland in the 26th minute, and Konstantinos Koulierakis received a yellow card for Greece in the 51st minute.
Giannis Konstantelias received a yellow card for Greece in the 67th minute, and Mikkel Peltola received a yellow card for Finland in the 90+4th minute.
Cristos Zafeiris received a yellow card for Greece in the 90+3rd minute.
Bjorn Kallman scored an own goal for Finland in the 38th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: No specific pre-game insights were mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: No specific post-match reflections were mentioned in the article.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on September 7th, 2024, at the Stadio Karaiskakis in Greece.
The UEFA Nations League standings after the match were: England 6 points, Greece 6 points, Republic of Ireland 2 points, and Finland 0 points.
Others: The match was broadcast live on TNT Sports and Eurosport.
